content.description: A slightly overhanging climb that starts with a big move on a partially detached flake. Continue up a few feet of face climbing to the obvious crackline which widens from fingers to hands to fist, then arm and body jams. Lots of great small ledges offer rest and security.

Crux at first bolt...

Mantle...

What's not so good about it is after the third bolt it is runout the rest of the way and is loose...

Another issue is a fall off near the top brings certain ground fall...(But it is easier 5th-class terrain)
content.protection:
UPDATED 1/19/19

Three draws

Someone was nice enough to add anchors to the route.

THANKS!!!...
content.location: At the end of the Group Campground road, hike from the bathroom to the "Chosspile mess" out on its own... On one of the east-facing formations you will see the three bolts...

content.description: The Far Side starts from a large block (comfortable for belaying on) to about 15' of face climbing to a couple of diagonal ledges on which you traverse up and right. It's mostly footwork until the upper, more vertical crack far to the right allows good hand use.Our church group of mixed ages found this an appropriate beginner's challenge, and enjoyed the fun, unobstructed rappel on this huge slab.
content.protection: Lead: small nuts/sm.cams/tricamsToprope: med. hexes/med cams/tricams/cordelette and 4' ext'n over semi sharp lip
